chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Cote was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark A. Cote is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark A. Cote was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Mark A. Cote was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Mark A. Cote was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  While on probation - DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  DOC will not be allowed to put a 'No contact" order between deft and his family w/o court's permission.

Minutes:  15CF669/15CF841/15CF1227.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Caviale.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CF1227 - (count 1) - deft sentenced to 5yrs & 8mos WSP; initial confinement of 32mos followed by 3yrs of ES.  See ES conditions.  Credit for 104 days.  Deft fined $2400 plus costs.  In default, 6mos WSP concurrent to mandatory sentence.  DL revoked for 3yrs.  IID ordered for 3yrs.  Deft not eligible for CIP or ERP.  All other counts - sentence w/held; deft placed on probation.  Count 2 - 2yrs, Count 3 - 2yrs, Count 4 - 2yrs, & Count 6 - 3yrs.  Probation sentences are concurrent to each other but CONSECUTIVE to count 1.  Probation conditions identical to those of ES.

15CF669 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 3yrs.  See conditions.  Probation is concurrent to probation sentences in files 15CF1227 & 15CF841, but CONSECUTIVE to count 1 in 15CF1227.

15CF841 - sentence w/held; placed on probation on all counts.  Count 1 - 2yrs, Count 2 - 3yrs, & Count 3 - 2yrs.  Probation sentences are concurrent to each other and current to probation sentences in files 15CF669 & 15CF1227 but CONSECUTIVE to count 1 in 15CF1227.

Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $1430.53.  Deft's bond shall be applied towards restitution & financial obligations.  Balance of bond may be returned to poster

Minutes:  15CF669/15CF841.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Caviale.  Sentencing hrg adj to 3/10/16 @ 2:30pm along w/15CF1227.  Bond revoked.  Deft taken into custody.  Cash bond to be held pending outcome of sentencing hrg.

Minutes:  15CF669/15CF841.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody (new charges - 15CF1227) w/Atty Caviale.  Defense counsel assumed the court would not proceed with sentencing on these two files since the deft has new charges pending; defense counsel has not reviewed the PSI w/deft.   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

Minutes:  15CF669/15CF841/15CF1019.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Caviale.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

15CF669 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Defense moves to allow contact between the parties.  No objection by the State.  Court lifts the no contact order.

15CF841 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1, 2, & 3; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

15CF1019 - case dismissed & read-in on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 1/27/16 @ 2pm.

Minutes:  15CF669/15CF841.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty John Caviale.  Atty Caviale reports these cases will be settled along with a new file which set for prelim tomorrow morning.  Plea hrg set for 11/30/15 @ 3:15pm.  Special Pros Wells requests that the court modified the bond in 15CF669 to allow the complaining witness to have telephone contact with the deft since they have two special needs children.  Complaining witness is present and concurs with the request.  Court grants the request; parties will be allowed to have phone contact concerning the needs of their children.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA K R Wells.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  15CF669/15CF841.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty John Caviale.  Atty Caviale requests adjournment; awaiting add'l discovery/authorization from the State.  FPT adj to 11/16/15 @ 2:45pm
